column4: is there any other way besides lspci to find out my pc specs/
kitche: well, i just bought this new mointor and it wants me to run X86Config
after doing sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg i selected the wrong resolution, editing xorg.conf doesn't fix the problem and when i open terminal it's just a white screen.
run it from a vtty, ctrl-alt-f1
is there a system restore or something so i can go back to my settings 10 minutes ago?
Those tools create backups of the xorg.conf files. You should have some extra copies in /etc/X11/ Then just sudo mv it on top of the one that isnt working.
I'm going afk so you'll have to ask the channel if you have any other issues, good luck.
ok i used one of my old xorg.conf files and it still isn't working
any idea how i can change my reso? nothing is working
doing that command you told me to do messed it all up
no, ccsm isnt the name of the package, its compizconfig-settings-manager.
